result.execSummary:
The defendant Evan A Coogan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carrying a Concealed Knife [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.231.
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-Sentence credit of 117 days is granted if revoked. 
-Court will allow early termination if deemed appropriate by Agent.

miscConds.notes:
-Standard court costs waived. DNA Surcharge to be paid as a condition of probation. 
-Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

-Follow through with any treatment, including mental health treatment, and/or counseling recommended by Agent. 
-Follow any conditions deemed appropriate by Agent.  
-No contact with Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint. 
-No contact with the Community Health Center listed in the Criminal Complaint unless there is Agent approval/permission.
-If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt:
2:14 PM; Case called for Jury status hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M Jay in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Evan A Coogan in court, in custody at WCJ.  Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for Evan A Coogan.  Court notes a plea questionnaire has been filed and recites the offer as listed on the form.  State and Defense confirm the offer.  Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 3 & 4, Court finds defendant guilty of Counts 3 & 4.  Court orders Counts 1 & 2 dismissed and read in.  Court will also cancel the jury trial scheduled for 8/30/2022.

Sentencing arguments made by the State.
Sentencing arguments made by Atty. Kershek.
Defendant presents statements.

COUNT 3:   
The Court Orders the Following:

Withheld sentence (Court will award 117 Days Credit IF defendant is revoked and sentenced)

Term of Probation: 2 Years - Court will allow for early termination if deemed appropriate by the Agent.

Conditions of Probation:
-	Follow through with any treatment, to include Mental Health treatment, and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
-	Follow any conditions deemed appropriate by Agent;
-	No contact with Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint.
-       No contact with the Community Health Center listed in the Criminal Complaint unless there is Agent approval/permission.

COSTS:  Waived by the Court.

DNA Surcharge: $200.00;

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid as a condition of probation. Failure to pay;  will result in a civil judgment.



COUNT 4:
The Court Orders the Following:

Withheld sentence (Court will award 117 Days Credit IF defendant is revoked and sentenced)

Term of Probation: 2 Years - Court will allow for early termination if deemed appropriate by the Agent.

Conditions of Probation:
-	Follow through with any treatment, to include Mental Health treatment, and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
-	Follow any conditions deemed appropriate by Agent;
-	No contact with Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint.
-       No contact with the Community Health Center listed in the Criminal Complaint unless there is Agent approval/permission.

COSTS:  Waived by the Court.

DNA Surcharge: $200.00;

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid as a condition of probation. Failure to pay;  will result in a civil judgment.

Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).

Jury status hearing on August 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person on August 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

01:42 PM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Defendant Evan A Coogan in court, in custody at WCJ, with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Nikole Kane appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Kershek provides an update, he is asking the matter be set for a 1 day jury trial.  No comment from the State.  Court will adjourn for jury status and jury trial.  Jury status hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

08:36 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Evan A Coogan in court, in custody at WCJ, with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Abigail Kincheloe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Kershek provides an update, he believes an offer is forthcoming and believes paries can resolve this matter.  Atty. Kershek is requesting this matter be set for plea and sentencing.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.  Court inquires if the defendant will still be in custody at the next court date.  Atty. Kershek believes the defendant will be released by the next court date. Defendant is advised that if he is released from custody he must appear in person for the next court date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Hearing on June 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

09:26 AM Defendant Evan A Coogan in court, in custody, with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.   Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
